Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Ouch \Ouch\ (ouch), n. [OE. ouch, nouche (a nouch being taken for an ouch: cf. {Adder}), fr. OF. nusche, nosche, nousche, buckle, clasp, LL. nusca, fr. OHG. nusca, nuscha.] A socket or bezel holding a precious stone; hence, a jewel or ornament worn on the person. [1913 Webster]
A precious stone in a rich ouche. --Sir T. Elyot. [1913 Webster]
Your brooches, pearls, and ouches. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
